IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: The Virginia Property Insurance Association (VPIA or "the Association") was established by the Virginia State Corporation Commission for the purpose of Administering a program of equitable distribution and placement of basic property insurance in compliance with the urban property protection and reinsurance act of 1968. The program became effective on July 26, 1968, as the Virginia Insurance Placement Facility and was reorganized as VPIA October 1, 1973. VPIA issues policies on behalf of its members who bear the direct risk on a pro-rata basis. VPIA is responsible for the collection of premiums, payment of commissions, losses and loss adjustment expenses, and also general administrative expenses. Assessments are made on participating companies for funds as they are needed.

Form990PartVIISectionAGrp.PersonNm: Mr David Bonenfant CPCU ChFC CLU

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Association qualifies under Section 501(c)(6) of the Internal Revenue Code (IRC) and is, therefore, not subject to taxation under present income tax laws. The Association is required to operate in conformity with the IRC to maintain its qualification. The Association is not aware of any course of action or events which have occurred that might adversely affect its qualified status.

Compensation of the General Manager and Assistant Manager is administered under VPIA's Salary Administration Program which is approved annually by the Board of Directors. Also, VPIA completed a salary study that was provided by an independent company to the Board of Directors.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Members of VPIA are defined as follows in Article V, Section A. of VPIA's Plan of Operations: "Members. All insurers licensed to write basic property insurance on a direct basis in Virginia, unless specifically exempted by law from participation in this Association, shall become Members of the Association by subscribing to this Plan of Operation and shall be referred to herein as Members."

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 7a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The election of members of the governing body is stated in Article VI. "Board of Directors", Sections A., B. & C. of VPIA's Plan of Operations: "A. Number, Selection. The Association shall be governed by a Board of fifteen directors composed of (1) four individuals appointed by the Commissioner, two of whom shall be licensed property and casualty agents and two of whom shall be from the general public, and (2) eleven Members, no two of which may be under common control or ownership, which shall be elected by cumulative vote of the Members. B. Term. Directors shall be annually appointed or elected, as the case may be, and shall serve for a period of one year or until their successors are appointed or elected and their designated representatives named. In the event of a vacancy occurring during the term if among appointed directors, a successor shall be appointed by the Commissioner and if among the Member directors, a successor shall be elected by the Board. C. Designation of Member Representation. As soon as practicable following the Annual Meeting of Members, each Member director shall designate a representative and an alternate representative and shall notify the Association in writing of such designations."

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 7b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: In accordance with Article VI. "Board of Directors", Section D. of VPIA's Plan of Operations, which states as follows: "D. Powers. The Board shall have all the powers vested in the Association under Chapter 27, Title 38.2 of the Code of Virginia and shall have such further powers and responsibilities as may be prescribed by this Plan of Operation or by the Members subject in either case to approval by the Commission, including, without limitation, the right in person or through representatives, to audit and inspect the books and records of any Member as to matters within the purview of this Plan of Operation or the Member's responsibilities as a Member of this Association. The Board may adopt such rules and rules of order as it deems necessary for the conduct of its business." As stated in Article IV, "Definitions" of VPIA's Plan of Operations, " 'Commission' means the State Corporation Commission of Virginia".

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The 990 is reviewed by the General Manager & Secretary, posted to the administrative section of VPIA's website for the Board of Directors, and emailed to each member of the Board of Directors prior to filing.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Annually, all of the Board of Directors and all employees are required to complete, sign, & date conflict of interest statements.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Compensation of the General Manager and Assistant Manager is administered under VPIA's Salary Administration Program which is approved annually by the Board of Directors. Also, VPIA completed a salary study that was provided by an independent company to the Board of Directors.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The governing documents, conflict of interest policy, and the financial statements are available to the public through VPIA's website.
($1546358) change in non-admitted assets and $2950 change in the post-retirement benefit obligation

ReasonableCauseExplanation.ExplanationTxt: Our organization is filing on time according to the website we have until 5:00 Eastern Time on 2/15/19. Our Fiscal year ends September 30, 2018 IRS E-filing Deadline: Midnight Eastern Time, Friday, February 15, 2019 Our E-filing Deadline: 5:00 PM Eastern Time, Friday, February 15, 2019 The IRS filing deadline for Organizations with a Fiscal Year end date of 9/30/2018 is Midnight Eastern Time on Friday, February 15, 2019.
